И да, фаталните инциденти са намалели от 51 000 на малко под 20 000, но не трябва да забравяме, че това не са просто числа, а истории на истински хора, наши съграждани, роднини, приятели, които никога не са се прибрали у дома.

Привилегията на свободното придвижване в целия Европейски съюз и шофиране зад граница не трябва да бъде предпоставка за създаване на имунитет при извършване на тежки нарушения в чужбина. С получаването си на свидетелство за управление ние автоматично ставаме отговорни за безопасността на всички участници в движението, в която и точка на Съюза да се намираме. С Директивата относно действието в целия Европейски съюз на определени решения, засягащи правото на управление на МПС, както и целият пакет за пътна безопасност, ни се дава възможност да променим картината, възможност, която не бива да пропускаме.

Крайната цел на тази директива е въздаването на справедливост чрез наказуемост на безразсъдното шофиране в чужбина, което много често за съжаление остава ненаказано. Чрез създаване на стройна система на сътрудничество и обмен на информация между страната на нарушения и страната на издаване на книжка се цели прекратяване на безнаказаността и повишаване в крайна сметка на пътната безопасност. Обхватът включва онези нарушения, които най-често водят до фатални инциденти. А именно превишена скорост с над 50 километра в час, шофиране под въздействие на алкохол, на наркотици и всякакви други нарушения, които водят до тежки наранявания или смърт. И да, смея да твърдя, че тази директива няма да реши самостоятелно въпроса, но със сигурност е стъпка към повишаването на пътната безопасност. Смятам, че подхода на Комисията беше добър, но като Парламент се опитахме да подобрим малко и да надградим това, което ни се предложи, в няколко направления.

Първо, времетраенето на процедурните правила. Много е важно да имаме фиксирано времетраене и информацията, обмена на информацията от страната на нарушение в страната на издаване на книжката, до информираността на нарушителя, всичко това дава прогнозируемост и плътност на директивата. Второ, разбира се, синхронизацията. Трябва да се стремим да синхронизираме там, където има възможност нарушения в страната на нарушение и в страната на издаване на книжката да бъдат, където повтарям и подчертавам, където това е възможно, колкото се може по-близки.

Възможността за урбанизираните зони и смятам, че 50 километра над допустимата скорост е твърде много в урбанизираните зони. Обръщаме внимание на това плюс съответната гъвкавост за всяка една държава, защото те влагат в това понятие различен смисъл. И разбира се, насърчаването и използването на система, която подобрява обмена между страните. И ние сме обърнали специално внимание затова, нека не забравяме, последно и с това завършвам, на пътя човекът никога не е сам. Нека да не чакаме трагедията да ни напомни защо е важна пътната безопасност и да гласуваме с разум.

Member of the Commission. – Mr President, honourable Members, let me start by thanking Mr Vitanov and the Committee on Transport and Tourism (TRAN) for the excellent report on the proposal for a directive on the Union-wide effect of certain driving disqualifications.

As you know, this proposal is an integral part of the Road Safety Package, which the Commission adopted in March 2023, and it has close links to the Driving Licence Directive and the Directive on cross-border exchange of information on road-safety-related traffic offences. The legislative framework created by these three pieces of legislation should be seen as vital to getting closer to reaching our goal of zero fatalities or serious injuries on European roads by 2050.

It will guarantee the high standards of skills and fitness of our drivers. It will also enable us to react in case certain individuals break the rules, putting themselves and other road users at risk. On that note, please allow me to ask a question: what is the main purpose of this proposal that we are discussing today? Of course, it is about driving disqualifications, but it is first and foremost about safety and fairness.

When it comes to safety, the efficient enforcement of driving disqualifications has clearly shown that it is a strong deterrent against major road safety—related traffic offences. Studies suggest that efficient enforcement not only increases the compliance of drivers who get sanctioned, but also shows to the wider driver population the risks they are taking should they decide to breach the law.

Secondly, let’s talk about fairness. Currently, for the same offence, a driver can be disqualified in the territory of the whole Union or simply in the territory of the Member State where the offence took place. This depends in which Member States his or her driving licence was issued. In the latter case, such a driver will be able to go to other Member States and continue driving as if nothing has happened. This situation is clearly unfair. Why should we keep allowing dangerous drivers on our roads? Putting an end to such unjustified differentiation of treatment would be the other core objective of our proposal.

There are also other important elements of fairness in the text – the grounds for refusal. We should ensure that our proposal remains reasonable, focusing on the most severe offences, and takes into consideration the differences we have between road traffic rules in the Member States. At the same time, the proposal also establishes clear conditions under which Member States can refuse a request to disqualify a driver. For example, if the offence committed would not be sanctioned with a driver disqualification in the Member State which issued the driving licence, or in the event that there are doubts or evidence of a breach of fundamental rights of the driver. Our proposal also contains safeguards for ensuring drivers’ rights, in particular when it comes to access to information, defence and data protection.

In conclusion, safety and fairness are the two elements that this proposal is all about. Ensuring safety by showcasing that everyone should respect the rules on the European roads and that no one enjoys impunity, should they breach those rules are very important as well. We also want to guarantee that offenders are treated on an equal footing.
I look forward to an interesting debate, and I count on the adoption of your report tomorrow, as it will be as an important step to improve safety on the roads.

im Namen der PPE-Fraktion. – Herr Präsident, sehr geehrte Frau Kommissarin, liebe Kolleginnen, liebe Kollegen! Das Dossier, über das wir heute beraten, ist Teil des Pakets für Straßenverkehrssicherheit, und insofern halte ich es schon für unglücklich, dass wir die Richtlinie über die unionsweite Wirkung bestimmter Entscheidungen über den Fahrberechtigungsverlust nicht gemeinsam mit der Führerscheinrichtlinie beraten und abstimmen. Denn es wäre eigentlich sinnvoll gewesen, das Paket zusammen zu behandeln, und ich finde es bedauerlich, dass einige Fraktionen hier im Hause das verhindert haben.

Die Grundidee des vorliegenden Vorschlags ist einfach und nachvollziehbar: Begeht ein Fahrer ein gravierendes Verkehrsdelikt, wie z. B. extreme Geschwindigkeitsüberschreitungen, das Fahren unter Alkohol- oder Drogeneinfluss sowie Verkehrsdelikte mit Todesfolge oder schwerer Körperverletzung, wo der Fahrer die Schuld trägt, so sollte der Fahrer in der ganzen Europäischen Union auch seinen Führerschein verlieren. Es geht um die Straßenverkehrssicherheit.

Nach den geltenden Vorschriften kann ein schweres Straßenverkehrsdelikt, das zum Entzug der Fahrerlaubnis führt, jedoch nicht EU-weit durchgesetzt werden, wenn das Delikt in einem anderen Mitgliedstaat begangen wurde als dem, wo der Führerschein ausgestellt wurde. Dass das heute überhaupt noch möglich ist, kann eigentlich niemand mehr erklären. Deswegen handelt es sich hier um einen wichtigen Vorschlag, den wir als Europäische Volkspartei auch unterstützen und den wir zügig behandeln möchten.

Aber wir müssen schon aufpassen, dass wir hier nicht mit sachfremden Dingen das Ganze überlagern. Erstens sollten wir nicht ein europäisches Punktesystem hier mit einfordern. Das macht keinen Sinn, und das werden wir als Europäische Volkspartei auch nicht mittragen. Das wirft eine Reihe von rechtlichen Fragen auf, und wer sich hier immer für die Rechtsstaatlichkeit einsetzt, sollte auch das EU-Recht beachten und nicht so etwas fordern.

Und zweitens wollen wir, dass die Mitgliedstaaten auch seriös damit umgehen. Wir könnten längst fertig sein, wenn der Rat sich bewegen würde. Schade, dass das wohl erst in der nächsten Legislaturperiode möglich ist.

en nombre del Grupo S&D. – Señor presidente, señora comisaria, para conseguir alcanzar el objetivo de la «visión cero», es decir, cero víctimas y heridos graves en las carreteras europeas en 2050, hace falta tomar medidas decisivas.

Desde 2010 la creación de un espacio europeo de seguridad vial ha sido uno de los objetivos de la Unión Europea encaminado a esa «visión cero». Y uno de los elementos principales de ese espacio europeo de seguridad vial es el que trata la propuesta que hoy debatimos: el reconocimiento recíproco de la privación del derecho a conducir. Esta propuesta pretende acabar con la situación de impunidad de aquellos conductores que cometen faltas graves fuera de sus países y a los que es difícil sancionar debidamente. Por tanto, es de gran importancia no solo para países turísticos, como España, Portugal, Italia, sino también para aquellos países del centro de Europa con mayores flujos de tráfico en tránsito.

Avanzamos en la buena dirección con la creación de un sistema de cooperación e intercambio de información sobre procedimientos relacionados con las infracciones. Pero no solo deberíamos cooperar cuando se dan las infracciones más graves: las penales. Habría que animar a los Estados miembros a que cooperen también con respecto a las administrativas. No se entiende que un conductor cometa repetidas infracciones en otro país y que, por no llegar a ser penales, no suponga ningún tipo de sanción por la falta de colaboración entre países.

Y, por último, sería muy positivo que se implantara a nivel europeo un sistema de licencias de conducir por puntos —como el que tenemos en España, que tan buenos resultados ha dado— y en el que se incluyeran todas las infracciones, independientemente del país en que se cometan.
Gracias, Petar, por tu informe. Sin medidas decisivas no llegaremos nunca a alcanzar la «visión cero» y este informe ayudará a ello.

en nombre del Grupo Renew. – Señor presidente, señora comisaria, esta Directiva avanza en el principio de que nuestra Unión es un espacio compartido de libertad y seguridad. Salvará cada año muchas vidas, porque va a evitar que un conductor sancionado en un Estado miembro con la pérdida del carnet de conducir pueda circular legalmente en otro Estado porque no somos capaces de compartir esta información. La retirada del carnet tendrá efecto inmediato en todos los Estados miembros cuando se deba al exceso de velocidad, a la conducción en estado de embriaguez o bajo los efectos de las drogas o a cometer infracciones que acarreen muertes o lesiones corporales graves. Es una reivindicación largamente reclamada por organizaciones como STOP Accidentes.

El final de este ámbito de impunidad se va a completar con otras normas que permitirán compartir datos y hacer efectivas en toda la Unión las multas de tráfico por infracciones graves. Son unas sanciones fundamentalmente económicas que han demostrado su capacidad disuasoria sobre los conductores inconscientes o con tendencias o aficiones temerarias.

Estamos, en consecuencia, ante un paquete legislativo que mejorará la seguridad vial en toda la Unión, pero me alegra especialmente el impacto que tendrá en las zonas transfronterizas. Las policías de tráfico que patrullan en estas áreas dan fe de que la conducción de sus nacionales más temerarios es muy distinta en el Estado limítrofe que la que observan en el propio. Los infractores saben que esta falta de cooperación convierte sus matrículas en una patente de corso. Y generan riesgos evitables que cuestan cada año muchas vidas. Esto también es construir Europa.

au nom du groupe Verts/ALE. – Monsieur le Président, mes chers collègues, Madame la Commissaire, nous avançons doucement sur le chemin du permis unique. Je dis doucement, parce que nous savons ici les frilosités des États membres à faire un vrai permis européen.

Pourtant il serait bien utile, ce permis européen, parce que nous avons 60 morts sur les routes par jour. Je le répète: 60 morts par jour, dans l’Union européenne. C’est dramatique, et c’est pour cela que nous préconisons un permis à points. C’est pour cela que nous devons surveiller les infractions partout où elles ont lieu sur les routes d’Europe et que ces sanctions doivent s’appliquer partout dans l’Union européenne. En bref, un permis juste, mais sans complaisance, sans impunité à l’égard de toutes les infractions.

Nous n’en sommes pas là, mais nous nous attaquons au moins à l’impunité des cas graves, c’est-à-dire les excès de vitesse et la consommation d’alcool et de stupéfiants. Nous y mettons fin, mais nous étendons la déchéance du permis partout dans ces cas-là.

za skupinu ECR. – Vážený pán predsedajúci, ak policajt pri závažnom porušení pravidiel zakáže zahraničnému vodičovi šoférovať auto, tento zákaz by podľa mňa mal platiť v celej Únii, nielen v danej krajine, ako je tomu dnes.

im Namen der ID-Fraktion. – Herr Präsident! Ja, gut gemeint heißt nicht unbedingt gut gemacht, das zeigt sich auch bei dem vorliegenden Entwurf für die Richtlinie zum unionsweiten Führerscheinentzug. Lenker, die stark alkoholisiert oder unter Drogeneinfluss fahren, Lenker, die grob fahrlässig einen tödlichen Unfall verursachen, die das Leben anderer mit ihrem Verhalten gefährden – solche Lenker gehören natürlich europaweit aus dem Verkehr gezogen. Da bin ich ganz beim Entwurf.

Leider schießt dieser Bericht aber weit über das Ziel hinaus; schließlich reden wir hier über Verwaltungsübertretungen. Eine europaweite Konsequenz muss ausdrücklich auf ganz genau definierte, besonders schwere Vergehen beschränkt bleiben. Alles, was auch nur einen Millimeter darüber hinausgeht, ist eine massive Untergrabung der Subsidiarität.

Der Begriff „schwere Verkehrsdelikte“ ist aber gerade keine genaue Definition. Wir brauchen eine exakte, taxative Aufzählung der Delikte. Ich lehne es entschieden ab, die Souveränität der Mitgliedstaaten über die Hintertür immer mehr auszuhöhlen. Das gilt insbesondere für den Bereich der inneren Sicherheit.

Weiters fordert dieser Bericht, dass der Strafrahmen für das begangene Delikt innerhalb der rechtlichen Grenzen zwischen zwei beteiligten Mitgliedstaaten so weit wie möglich angepasst werden soll. Das geht überhaupt nicht. Wie kommt die Rechtsordnung eines Landes A dazu, den geltenden Strafrahmen für ein Delikt an den Strafrahmen eines Landes B, also einer fremden Rechtsordnung anzupassen?

Da stellt sich mir dann sofort die Frage: Was fordert die EU als nächstes? Eine unionsweite Anpassung des Strafrechts etwa? Das wäre nur ein weiterer Schritt hin zur Gründung der Vereinigten Staaten von Europa, und diesem Ziel erteile ich eine klare Absage.

Es wäre also sinnvoll, diesen Entwurf noch einmal zu überarbeiten. In der aktuellen Form kann ich nicht zustimmen, und deshalb haben wir auch einen Zurückweisungsantrag eingebracht, weil eben der vorliegende Entwurf die rechtliche Souveränität der Mitgliedstaaten untergräbt. Er verstößt ganz einfach gegen das Subsidiaritätsprinzip.
– Senhor Presidente, Senhora Comissária, discutimos hoje parte do pacote legislativo sobre segurança rodoviária.

A segurança nas estradas constitui uma preocupação efetiva e que nos deve mobilizar a todos. Os dados recentes, abrangendo o período de 2011 a 2021, revelam um aumento de 6 % nas fatalidades rodoviárias da União Europeia, pondo fim a uma década de declínios sucessivos.
Perante cada uma destas vidas perdidas nas estradas, cabe-nos a nós, enquanto colegisladores, refletir sobre as medidas a implementar para alterar esta realidade desoladora.

A percentagem de mortalidade nas estradas portuguesas é a oitava mais elevada da União. Em 2021, lamentavelmente, foram registadas 561 mortes devido a acidentes de viação, um aumento relativamente às 536 ocorridas em 2020. Importa sublinhar que cada número destes espelha uma vida, o que nos deve convocar a todos para analisar a fundo as diversas causas subjacentes e como podemos trabalhar melhor para reduzir estes números.

Estamos convencidos de que a introdução de um sistema europeu unificado de pontos não será suficiente para reverter esta tendência. Em Portugal, no meu país, já vigora um sistema semelhante e não quero, contudo, dizer que isto não se reflita. Precisamos, pois, de fazer mais.

Termino, pois, dizendo que estamos juntos para trabalhar na segurança das nossas estradas, sem sobrecarregar com regras, não olhando apenas para punir os infratores, mas, acima de tudo, melhorando as redes viárias de cada um dos países e com o devido apoio europeu.

– Panie Przewodniczący! W przeciwieństwie do przed chwilą występujących mówców chciałem powiedzieć: Pani Komisarz, Panie Pośle Sprawozdawco, Posłanki i Posłowie, gratuluję tej inicjatywy! Po prostu dyrektywa trafia w cel. To nieprawda, że się gdzieś omija cel. Po drugie, padł zarzut, że należało to zrobić przy okazji praw jazdy czy ewentualnie ścigania transgranicznych przekroczeń w sprawozdaniu pana Kosmy Złotowskiego. Należało to zrobić i to robimy. I to jest podstawowa zaleta. To, co chciałbym szczególnie podkreślić – to, co powinniśmy przekazać jako wiadomość – dotyczy to ludzi. To nie jest rozmowa abstrakcyjna. To jest rozmowa o bezpieczeństwie użytkowników dróg, ulic, w miastach, poza miastami, czyli to, co jest dla ludzi szczególnie ważne, i przez co oni oceniają także swoją Unię Europejską.

Kluczowa sprawa, którą chciałbym tutaj wyeksponować w swoim wystąpieniu, to jest to, że dyrektywa powinna przynieść świadomość nieuniknięcia lub niskie prawdopodobieństwo uniknięcia kary za wykroczenia drogowe popełnione za granicą. I my wiemy, jakie to są poważne przestępstwa drogowe. Nie potrzeba tutaj nowej definicji wypracowywać, jak to jeden z przedmówców mówił. A zatem to, co jest szczególnie ważne – sprawność działania, koordynacja, ujednolicenie procedur. I istota rzeczy bardzo ważna, czyli długość trwania procedury, tak żebyśmy wiedzieli kto, za co i w jakim czasie odpowiada. I rola RESPER, Europejska Sieć Praw Jazdy – to jest to, co powinniśmy wykorzystać. Dziękuję za uwagę. Gratuluję.

– Herr Präsident, sehr geehrte Frau Kommissarin, liebe Kolleginnen und Kollegen! Oberstes Ziel in Europa ist die Senkung der Zahl von Verkehrstoten auf Null bis zum Jahr 2050. Mit dem nun vorliegenden Bericht können wir buchstäblich Leben retten – vielen Dank dafür an Petar Vitanov. Derzeit bleiben rund 40 % der grenzüberschreitenden Verkehrsverstöße ungeahndet. Wer sich im Ausland nicht an die Verkehrsregeln hält, muss in Zukunft den Führerscheinentzug fürchten.

Bisher war es möglich, den Führerschein neu zu beantragen, wenn er im Ausland entzogen wurde, etwa mit der Begründung, man habe ihn verloren, oder man hat einfach einen neuen Führerschein in einem anderen Land gemacht – eigentlich kaum nachvollziehbar. Damit ist nun Schluss. Der Verlust der Fahrerlaubnis gilt künftig europaweit.

Ich begrüße die neuen Regeln. Verstöße wie überhöhte Geschwindigkeit, Fahren unter Alkohol- oder Drogeneinfluss, Fahren ohne gültigen Führerschein, gefährliches Überholen oder gefährliches Parken werden künftig europaweit geahndet werden können bis zur Aberkennung der Fahrerlaubnis. Damit wird die Sicherheit auf den Straßen in der gesamten EU erhöht und die Zahl der Verletzten und Toten im Straßenverkehr gesenkt.

– Mr President, Commissioner and colleagues, despite it only being five weeks into 2024, 18 people have already lost their lives on Irish roads this year. 2023 had the highest fatality rate in nearly a decade in Ireland, made worse by a substantial increase in the number of deaths of young people.

The Road Safety Authority in Ireland has noted that this isn’t just an Irish phenomenon. All over Europe, there has been an increase in fatal crashes since the end of COVID. A recent study by Eurostat found that road fatalities in the EU have increased by 6% after a decade of continuous decline.

A new EU directive to extend driving disqualifications is very welcome. To ensure road safety and effective enforcement of road safety regulations, it is crucial that the EU takes a consistent approach to recognising and enforcing driver disqualifications across the Member States. Public awareness campaigns to inform EU citizens of mutual recognition of disqualifications is absolutely essential. Mounting fatalities on both Irish and EU roads have increased the urgency of these measures.

εξ ονόματος της ομάδας The Left. – Κύριε Πρόεδρε, εάν ένας οδηγός διαπράξει σήμερα κάποια παράβαση σε χώρα διαφορετική από αυτή που του έχει εκδώσει την άδεια οδήγησης και αυτή η άδεια του αφαιρεθεί, η κύρωση θα ισχύει, στη συντριπτική πλειοψηφία των περιπτώσεων, μόνο στη χώρα όπου διαπράχθηκε η παράβαση και δεν συνεπάγεται περιορισμούς στα υπόλοιπα κράτη μέλη της Ευρωπαϊκής Ένωσης. Ο οδηγός αυτός, λοιπόν, θα μπορεί, ενώ του έχει αφαιρεθεί το δίπλωμα, να συνεχίζει να οδηγεί κανονικά στα υπόλοιπα 26 κράτη μέλη. Η κατάσταση αυτή υπονομεύει την ασφάλεια των οδικών μεταφορών σε όλα τα κράτη μέλη, αλλά ιδιαίτερα σε χώρες που αποτελούν σημαντικούς τουριστικούς προορισμούς και υποδέχονται πολλούς ξένους οδηγούς. Η οδηγία, λοιπόν, αυτή συμπληρώνει το κενό που υπάρχει και οδηγεί σε ατιμωρησία και περιλαμβάνει σοβαρές οδικές παραβάσεις, όπως υπερβολική ταχύτητα, οδήγηση υπό την επήρεια αλκοόλ ή ναρκωτικών και περιστατικά που έχουν ως αποτέλεσμα τον θάνατο ή σοβαρό σωματικό τραυματισμό λόγω τροχαίας παράβασης. Κύριοι συνάδελφοι, κάθε χρόνο χάνουν τη ζωή τους στους ευρωπαϊκούς δρόμους περισσότεροι από 20.000 συμπολίτες μας. Το τίμημα αυτό είναι απαράδεκτο, αλλά όχι αναπόφευκτο. Η οδηγία αυτή θα συμβάλει καθοριστικά τόσο στη βελτίωση της οδικής ασφάλειας στους δρόμους της Ευρώπης όσο και στη μείωση του αριθμού των θυμάτων από τροχαία δυστυχήματα.

– Domnule președinte, doamna comisară, stimați colegi, directiva pe care o dezbatem astăzi, legată de decăderea din dreptul de a conduce are un singur scop, și anume salvarea de vieți, reducerea accidentelor rutiere.

Sigur că avem accidente rutiere nu numai din cauza șoferilor care poate sunt băuți, consumă droguri, au viteză excesivă, dar și din cauza infrastructurii, acesta fiind un alt subiect, ca în toate statele membre, să reușim să avem o infrastructură rutieră corespunzătoare. Dar da, sunt de acord ca să fie tratați la fel cei care încalcă regulile de circulație rutieră, pentru că viața are aceeași valoare, indiferent în ce țară se întâmplă accidentul. Prevenția este foarte importantă, rigorile legii de asemenea.

Sigur, avem dreptul să circulăm, este un drept fundamental, dar avem și responsabilitatea de a nu pune în pericol viețile copiilor, ale persoanelor în vârstă. Accidentele sunt mai ales în orașe, dar și pe autostrăzi. De aceea sunt de acord și susțin ca această directivă să se aplice în spațiul european, să avem o siguranță în toate statele membre.

– Mr President, this cross-border directive is an attempt to force Member States to exchange information in relation to certain driving disqualifications. As you know, if a driver is convicted of an offence in one country, the sanctions only apply to that country at the moment.

I’m a bit sceptical of cross-border directives and whether they are required at all. Take, for example, the EU Commission’s flagship cross-border directive on health. Ten years since its implementation, and the Commission itself accepts that the directive has been a failure.

If a person has been convicted, for example, of excessive speed – and whatever that means – should they be punished in 27 Member States? It seems a bit mad to me. I think that’s a bit over the top. I’m just wondering, is this part of building a United States of Europe, or is just an effort to increase bureaucracy? It doesn’t make an awful lot of sense to me.

– Mr President, I think this is an important file, but it should be handled carefully. We don’t want data bogged down for minor misdemeanours. We have a history of problems in Ireland with the way in which our police force have managed traffic offences, with a lot of political or Garda interference in that.

I think this should be about enforcing driving disqualification across the EU for offences where the seriousness of the behaviour results in major harm or death. Thanks to the heroic work of one Irish mother, Lucia O’Farrell, and the O’Farrell family, this issue is very well known in Ireland. In 2011, Shane O’Farrell had just finished his law exams. He was 23 years old and he was knocked down as he cycled home. He was left to die on the side of the road by a driver who failed to stop: a driver who had been at that time out on bail for multiple charges of criminality and traffic offences. A Lithuanian who was convicted of dangerous driving causing death but acquitted on the basis that he leaves the country. How is that fair to the people of Lithuania that he would be sent back, exposing them to danger? How is that justice?
Member of the Commission. – Mr President, thank you very much, dear Members, for a lively discussion and also for a broad support for the idea and for this proposal.

I’m really happy to see that apart from the divergent views on some specific issues, the Parliament, I’m interpreting, is ready to support our proposal. A few words on some of the issues which were raised. Again, we are talking here about a package. We would have loved to see the whole package adopted at the same time. All the package elements will work together to ensure road safety. On the other hand, each proposal is a different tool, which, together with the others, will create a basket of tools to address road safety. So, from this perspective, driving licences focus on skills and training, and the cross-border enforcement focuses on better enforcement of road safety offences. Driving disqualifications focus on the most severe offences which should result in driving disqualification in the Union.

We paid a lot of attention to subsidiarity. On the other hand, of course, it is not possible to have a Union-wide effect without a Union intervention. But I would say balance is in the text, preserving Member States’ competence and especially thanks to the grounds for refusal.

It was a discussion about the penalty points under the scope of the directive; I’ve noticed the willingness in the recitals of the adopted report to assess the feasibility of eventually including the so-called demerit points under the scope of the directive. While I see the good intention behind this request, let me recall you that such point systems are, by their very nature, designed as long-term solutions to sanction perpetrators of repeated minor offences, with different seriousness assigned to them. As opposed to this, the proposal primarily concerns people who are committing the most serious offences in transit that should lead to their immediate disqualification.

Again, these are a couple of remarks. It is indeed a file which will bring concrete understanding and positive effects, I would say, for all citizens and all those who are sharing the roads, let’s hope in a safer way. Thank you very much for the debate and I really hope that you will vote on this, even though I’m sorry it’s not going to be adopted in this legislature because the Council is delayed. But what you are going to send with your report is a strong signal that it is needed, and I think the citizens will understand this signal.

докладчик. – Г-н Председател, аз също съм наистина удовлетворен да видя, че толкова много хора от различни политически семейства подкрепят предложението. И според мен това се дължи не само на това, че ние всички сме участници в движението по пътищата или че няма някой в тази зала, чийто близък, роднина или познат, или приятел да не е станал жертва на пътен инцидент. Но си мисля, че без значение от политическото семейство, двата основни принципа, които се опитваме да подобрим – справедливостта и безопасността, са водещи за всички нас.

Сега, аз съм убеден, че при тази ангажираност ще съумеем да подобрим законодателството за пътната безопасност, което е в интерес на гражданите и на всяка една държава. Понеже имаше две критики от г-н Хайдер и г-н Уолас, първо само четири вида нарушения са. Не става дума за всякакви нарушения, а именно за онези, които причиняват най-много тежки инциденти по пътищата. И второ, по отношение на синхронизацията. Тук стремежът не е да унифицираме наказателните ни системи. Трябва да е ясно, че когато извършим нарушения зад границата, наказанията са на база на правната рамка на страната, издала книжката. Синхронизацията може да дойде в случаите, когато нямаме фиксирано наказание, а плаващо такова и когато е плаващо, тогава това наказание би следвало да се синхронизира с наказанието в страната на извършване на нарушението. Така че хубавото е, че всеки един подчертава, че успехът на тази директива зависи от сътрудничеството между страните членки и от навременния поток на информация между тях.

И последно, вярвам, че тази директива не само ще спомогне за намаляване на инцидентите, но давайки ѝ гласност, ще остави отпечатък в съзнанието на всички ни и ще ни насърчи да бъдем по-внимателни, отговорни и безкомпромисни в следването на правилата, независимо къде шофираме.

írásban. – A járművezetéstől való egyes eltiltások uniós szintű hatálya javaslat kiemelt jelentőséggel bír a tagállami és uniós szintű közlekedésbiztonsági célok elérésében. Súlyos közlekedési szabálysértések esetében közlekedésbiztonsági szempontból messzemenőkig támogatandó, hogy a vezetéstől való eltiltás uniós hatállyal bírjon. Semmivel sem indokolható, hogy a súlyos szabálysértést elkövető személy csak az elkövetés helye szerinti tagállamban legyen eltiltva a vezetéstől, például kábítószerhasználat miatt, és a másik 26 tagállamban pedig tovább vezethessen. A javaslat megfelelő eljárási garanciákat és mentesítő alapokat irányoz elő, ami biztosítja, hogy az uniós hatály csak valóban indokolt esetekben következhessen be. A büntetőpont-rendszer uniós szintű kiterjesztésével viszont nem tudok egyetérteni. A tagállamok között fennálló különbségek olyan mértékűek e tekintetben, hogy ezek összekapcsolása nem lenne lehetséges. Továbbá nem is lenne indokolt. A szubszidiaritás elvével összhangban ezt a kérdést tagállami hatáskörben kell hagyni.

Member of the Commission. – Mr President, honourable Members, almost three years after the assassination of President Moïse, the multilayered crisis in Haiti rages on.

We read with concern the latest report by the United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti about rampant insecurity, the strength of armed gangs and the limited capacity of state institutions to restore security and rule of law. The capacity of gangs to gather large quantities of arms and ammunition is of particular concern, and violent incidents – including killings, kidnappings, sexual violence – persist with alarming impunity.

There is an urgent need to take action to stop the illegal proliferation of firearms and ammunition in the country. This is an area where the European Union is willing to continue offering its support to Haiti, and other Caribbean countries facing similar challenges.

Innocent citizens continue to pay the highest price. A chronic security, economic and political crisis, exacerbated by natural catastrophes, has led to the current humanitarian crisis in Haiti. Today, more than 40 % of the Haitian population suffers from acute food insecurity. Recurrent cholera outbreaks continue to claim numerous victims. The Haitian state cannot be left alone in its fight against the gangs and the multifold crisis the country needs to address.

Haiti’s international partners, including the United Nations, have a crucial role to play. The resolution of the United Nations Security Council, passed on 2 October last year, authorising a multinational security mission in support of Haiti to be led by Kenya, was an important and long-overdue breakthrough. The same resolution indicates the need to create effective accountability mechanisms to protect human rights, and to avoid the mistakes made during the previous UN-led mission, MINUSTAH, which ended in 2017.

The EU has taken note of the recent ruling of Kenya’s High Court on the proposed deployment of Kenyan police to lead the mission. We are awaiting with interest the response of the Kenyan Government to enable the mission to proceed.

The European Union will continue to provide support for Haiti’s stability, development and better integration in the Caribbean region. Our cooperation and humanitarian envelope for Haiti is by far the largest in the Americas.

Despite the many difficulties in implementing our programmes, the European Union remains committed to play its part alongside our international partners, and will continue supporting the broader objectives of a multinational support mission once it is deployed – restoring stability, supporting governance, both indirectly through our cooperation instruments, and directly through our support for the Haitian National Police.

Alongside the security track, it is important to continue pursuing a political solution to take the country out of the current crisis. We welcome the active involvement of regional organisations, particularly the CARICOM and the Organization of American States, supporting a Haitian-led political solution built on the basis of a constructive dialogue between the Government and the Opposition.

Unfortunately, we regret to see how the Haitian parties have failed to come together around a credible solution to the current institutional impasse. Haitians deserve better than this. We urge, therefore, the main political stakeholders to engage in a genuine dialogue and renew their efforts to find an effective compromise, with the ultimate goal to prepare the country for credible and inclusive elections once security conditions will allow.

za skupinu PPE. – Pane předsedající, dámy a pánové, vážená paní komisařko, já si myslím, že to je mimořádně důležité téma, které probíráme. Situace na Haiti v posledních letech od atentátu na tamního prezidenta, v posledních čtyřech letech, je naprosto neúnosná a pořád se zhoršuje. Jak zde bylo řečeno paní komisařkou, je zde mise, kterou pod záštitou OSN mají realizovat některé státy pod vedením Keni. V této misi přislíbila podporu již celá řada států, například Spojené státy americké, Kanada a tak dále. A my bychom určitě neměli stát bokem. To znamená, že pokud dnešní jednání povede k tomu, že budeme – EU – v této iniciativě více aktivní, že podpoříme tamní mezinárodní mise, že poskytneme další peníze jako humanitární pomoc, tak je to jedině dobře. Ta situace je naprosto tristní. Více než polovina obyvatel Haiti trpí obrovskou nouzí. Zdravotní prostředky, jídlo není v dostatečné míře a je zde velký prostor pro humanitární pomoc.

Osobně si ale myslím, že ta pomoc může být reálná až ve chvíli, kdy zkrátka mezinárodní jednotky zajistí distribuci této pomoci. V tuto chvíli velmi hrozí, že pokud bychom poskytovali větší humanitární pomoc, tak ta bude rozkradena, rozebrána gangy. Gangy, které tam působí – více než 80 gangů –, které navíc způsobují obrovské utrpení tamních obyvatel, kriminalitu a tak dále. Takže je třeba zajistit mezinárodní akci, zajistit alespoň základní fungování tohoto státu, který je v rozkladu, a pak můžeme poskytovat humanitární pomoc, za kterou bych se přimlouval.

em nome do Grupo S&D. – Senhor Presidente, Senhora Comissária, o Haiti é apenas mais um exemplo de um País que reúne todas as condições para ser classificado como um Estado falhado. E, não obstante todos os esforços, é assim que pode e deve continuar a ser classificado neste momento.

Há demasiados interesses e demasiados interessados em semear por todo o globo os Estados falhados. Estados que são mercados da impunidade, mas, ao mesmo tempo, cenários do intolerável sofrimento dos seus povos.
Nós, europeus, membros de uma parceria de paz, liberdade e respeito pelas pessoas e pelos seus direitos, não podemos ficar indiferentes perante estas situações.
Nas resoluções que aprovámos sobre o Haiti apelámos sempre a uma ação concertada da comunidade internacional para fazer face ao caos político, à violência e às necessidades de apoio humanitário.

Depois das acusações feitas em relação à má-conduta de algumas forças da ONU no Haiti, os mais recentes pontos de situação identificam uma estratégia mais focada na reconstrução dos pilares onde pode assentar uma normalização da situação, incluindo a criação de uma plataforma política capaz de assumir o controlo institucional e retomar a aplicação do quadro constitucional em vigor.
É fundamental que as sanções penalizem os responsáveis pela situação e protejam do seu impacto as populações necessitadas.
Os esforços de diálogo na sociedade civil devem ser incentivados.

A parceria entre iguais no quadro do novo Acordo de Samoa, de que o Haiti será um membro ativo, deverá ser acionada para gerar respostas multilaterais às fraturas globais entre blocos e «terras de ninguém» mais pejadas de iniquidade e sofrimento.

Na Assembleia Parlamentar Caraíbas-União Europeia, que será formalmente constituída dentro de duas semanas na reunião da Assembleia Parlamentar Paritária ACP-UE, em Luanda, Angola, não deixaremos de seguir de perto a situação vivida pelo povo do Haiti.

au nom du groupe Renew. – Monsieur le Président, Madame la Commissaire, Haïti se meurt. L’heure n’est plus aux incantations. La situation sur place est catastrophique. Elle s’aggrave chaque jour et laisse derrière elle un pays au bord du gouffre. En réponse à la crise sécuritaire, l’ONU a décidé de déployer une force militaire, bien que l’on ignore quand.

La crise en Haïti n’est pas seulement une crise sécuritaire, c’est aussi une crise politique: un État qui s’effondre, une corruption généralisée, des injustices énormes, un gouvernement illégitime aux yeux des citoyens. Il est temps pour la communauté internationale et pour l’Union européenne de soutenir, en Haïti, un processus de dialogue politique qui mène à la formation d’un gouvernement de transition, véritablement représentatif, soutenu par une large majorité de la société. C’est en s’attaquant aux causes profondes de la crise haïtienne que nous pourrons aider le pays à se reconstruire sur des bases solides. On ne pourra pas régler le problème et la situation en Haïti sans les Haïtiens.

w imieniu grupy ECR. – Pani Komisarz! Panie Przewodniczący! Trudno się nie zgodzić z tymi głosami, które dzisiaj padły już na tej sali, że sytuacja na Haiti jest dramatyczna. Od lat pogłębiający się kryzys migracyjny, wewnętrzne walki gangów, korupcja, słabość rządu – to tylko niektóre z trudności, z jakimi boryka się ten najbiedniejszy na Karaibach kraj.

Wydaje się, że wysłanie międzynarodowej misji stabilizacyjnej jest w tej sytuacji jedynym sposobem, aby powstrzymać spiralę przemocy, umożliwić władzom odzyskanie kontroli nad krajem oraz przywrócić porządek. Tutaj chciałbym podkreślić, jak ważne jest, aby instytucje Unii Europejskiej oraz państwa członkowskie zaangażowały się w zapewnienie personelu, sprzętu oraz zasobów finansowych i logistycznych na potrzeby takiej międzynarodowej, stabilizacyjnej misji. – Monsieur le Président, chers collègues, Madame la Commissaire, pas loin de la Guadeloupe – donc de l’Union européenne –, Haïti est notre île sœur. – Mr President, another US-backed and funded occupation of Haiti.

Member of the Commission. – Mr President, Members, thank you for the debate. The atmosphere is sombre, I would say, because of what is going on and also a bit of a negative feeling I can detect in all the speakers.

At the last summit we had, EU-CELAC, the UN, partner countries in Latin America and the Caribbean agreed on the need to support Haiti in tackling the dire humanitarian crisis and in paving the way towards security and stabilisation.

For countries like Haiti, the proliferation of illicit small arms and light weapons is at the origin of the strength of the gangs and is detrimental to the achievement of sustainable peace, security and socio-economic development, including in the rest of the region. Therefore, the summit declaration included specific provisions on the fight against illicit arms trafficking, which is instrumental to curb domestic and transnational organised crime, drug trafficking, trafficking in persons, money laundering, the illegal exploitation of natural resources, and domestic violence.

In the same declaration, we also stressed the need to consolidate and strengthen the EU-CELAC cooperation initiatives in the field of citizen security and social justice, such as EU-LAC Partnership on Justice and Security. On these themes, the EU is ready to do its part.

Regarding the participation directly to the multinational security intervention (MSSM) in Haiti, I should remind you that the EU’s support could consist in actions that support the mission and indirectly, notably with complementary actions that could provide an enabling environment for the work of the mission or help the sustainability of its results.

Prospects for a direct EU contribution in terms of equipment and personnel would depend directly on the readiness of the EU Member States to contribute, and in any case, we should stress that the EU is already providing significant and indirect support to the Kenyan Defence Forces through the European Peace Facility to increase their capability in order to participate in peacekeeping operations, and we hope this is the case now.
So thank you very much for the debate, President, that is all.

Nemůžeme řešit pouze environmentální aspekty klimatické změny, která skutečně probíhá a já ji rozhodně nezpochybňuji, ale je důležité upozornit i na bezpečnostní rizika, která jsou s touto klimatickou změnou spojena. Jde zejména o prevenci proti požárům a také společnou akci při zvládání těchto událostí.

I Česká republika před dvěma lety čelila jednomu z největších požárů i ve srovnání celoevropského měřítka. Jednalo se o požár v Národním parku České Švýcarsko. A děkujeme podpoře německých, italských hasičů. Musíme daleko více koordinovat naše vzájemné zásoby, zdroje, které máme ať v oblasti letectví, ať v oblasti hasičů, ať v oblasti policejní podpory. Toto je myslím jedna z úloh, kterou od nás evropští občané očekávají.

– Г-жо Председател, Европейският парламент и Комисия многократно са подкрепяли пълноправното членство на България и Румъния в Шенген. Двете страни изпълняват всички технически критерии и въпреки това повече от десетилетие ние се намираме на вратата на Шенген.

Считано от 31-ви март тази година, България и Румъния ще станат част от Шенгенското пространство, но само по въздух и вода. Какво означава това? Отговорът е ясен, дискриминационното отношение към гражданите на двете страни продължава. Равни сме по изисквания и задължения, но не и по постигнати резултати. Подобен двоен стандарт не бива да съществува. Самозалъгването, че частичното членство в Шенген е успех, е неприемливо. Нима има концепция за частична дискриминация? Не!
Нашите съграждани заслужават пълноправно членство в Шенген и всичко друго е неприемливо и ние ще продължим да се борим за това.

– Señor presidente, la veda impuesta en el Golfo de Vizcaya para proteger a los delfines carece de un estudio de impacto. Ha evitado a los consejos consultivos e ignora las evidencias científicas. Un estudio del instituto oceanográfico de Euskadi AZTI acredita que los pingers reducen en un 90 % las capturas incidentales de estos cetáceos. No ha importado. Tampoco las recomendaciones del Consejo Internacional para la Explotación del Mar o la experiencia de barcos como el Caraba de Bermeo, con décadas de pesca y cámaras a bordo. Su patrón, Jon Lartitegi, puede demostrar que jamás han pescado un delfín.

Estamos ante una clara vulneración de la PPC con efectos desastrosos para el mercado, el empleo y la libre competencia. Un ejemplo: dos barcos ondarreses, el Kaxu y el Kaxarra, invirtieron en pingers y observadores para proteger a los delfines. Sus veintidós tripulantes están hoy en un expediente de regulación de empleo. Los 170 000 kilos de merluza y gallo que podrían capturar no llegarán al mercado. Subirá el paro y se encarecerá la cesta de la compra. Y así en toda la costa, cuya flota recibirá distintas compensaciones.
SOS delfines, sin duda, pero no con medidas decididas contra y no con el sector.

– Senhor Presidente, o problema gravíssimo que está a afetar milhares e milhares de famílias com o aumento das taxas de juro e o aumento das prestações do crédito à habitação é um problema europeu que afeta muitos territórios como o meu, a Galiza, onde os salários continuam baixos e onde os preços das coisas básicas para a vida são cada vez mais altos.
As famílias estão afogadas pelos pagamentos aos bancos e, sobretudo, por exemplo na Galiza, baixaram os contratos novos para comprar casa, as hipotecas, em 38 % no mês de novembro do ano passado.
O problema da habitação existe há anos e cada vez é mais grave, com a subida progressiva das taxas de juro por parte do Banco Central Europeu.

Que não nos engane a Sra. Lagarde, que não nos enganem os bancos, que não nos enganem os cúmplices dos bancos, como o Partido Popular no meu país, com o Sr. Rueda à cabeça, que foi incapaz de criar habitação pública para fazer frente a esta problemática.
O aumento da Euribor nos nossos povos, para quem tem uma hipoteca de tipo variável, é uma grande parte do salário dos lares.
Espero que esta situação mude a partir do dia 18 de fevereiro e os galegos sabem porquê.

– Voorzitter, afgelopen week werd Europa — en Brussel in het bijzonder — wakker geschud door boze boeren. Waarom zijn zij toch zo kwaad? Dat komt omdat de EU hen constant overlaadt met meer en meer regels. De Commissie—Von der Leyen beloofde minder regeldruk, maar doet het tegenovergestelde.

Vrijdag is een belangrijke dag, want dan beslissen de lidstaten erover of ze groen licht geven voor de zogeheten richtlijn inzake passende zorgvuldigheid, een richtlijn die zogenaamd de economie nog verder moet verduurzamen, maar in werkelijkheid bedrijven opzadelt met een barrage van regels en rapportageverplichtingen. De winnaar van deze richtlijn zijn de grote consultancy- en advocatenkantoren. De pineut zijn de ondernemer en de klanten, die extra kosten doorberekend krijgen.

Geen enkel bedrijf heeft behoefte aan nieuwe bureaucratische lasten. Het is te hopen dat de lidstaten dit onding vrijdag naar de prullenbak verwijzen. Anders, verzeker ik u, staan de boeren straks niet alleen.

– Signor Presidente, onorevoli colleghi, nei prossimi mesi la Presidenza belga sarà chiamata ad affrontare numerose sfide, tra le quali vi è quella di garantire e assicurare il sostegno all'agricoltura europea.

Non mi riconosco in questa Europa che preferisce difendersi con il filo spinato e favorire le importazioni di prodotti alimentari che non rispettano gli standard europei e la tracciabilità alimentare. Ebbene, io sto con gli agricoltori e contro questa Europa che non sa dare risposte alle loro necessità. Una follia che vuole portare al collasso la filiera italiana, che conta 4 milioni di lavoratori e un fatturato di 600 miliardi.

La nuova Presidenza dimostri che la nostra Unione non è l'Europa dei grandi interessi economici delle multinazionali, bensì dei cittadini. L'Europa stia dalla parte giusta e il filo spinato lo usi per difendere i nostri prodotti tipici.

– Mr President, the assembly in the north of Ireland has elected an Irish citizen, a republican, a pro-Irish-unity First Minister. I want to congratulate Michelle O’Neill on her election to that role. We must harness the full potential of this decade of opportunity for our island. Now is the time for the European Parliament and the Belfast Assembly to begin formalising direct engagement between our two institutions.

Many laws of the EU single market apply in the North, but we have a democratic deficit and only direct engagement between MLAs and MEPs will allow two million Irish and British citizens in the north of Ireland to have a platform for their views to be represented in the policymaking process.

Let us embrace the progress made over the weekend and let us build upon it. A united Ireland inside the EU has huge potential. Let us all work together to help bring about that future as outlined in the Good Friday Agreement.

– Tisztelt Elnök Úr! Múlt héten emlékezett meg a világ a holokauszt áldozatairól, akiknek körülbelül egyötöde volt roma származású a legújabb kutatások szerint. A romák pedig a mai napig is Európa legnagyobb és legszegényebb, legdiszkrimináltabb kisebbsége. 2011-ben viszont a magyar elnökség tető alá hozott egy európai uniós roma integrációs keretstratégiát. Azonban az elmúlt 13 évben úgy látjuk, hogy jelentős javulást csak Magyarországon észleltünk. Itt az ideje, hogy felerősítsük a keretstratégiának és a nemzeti felzárkóztatási stratégiáknak a végrehajtását a többi tagállamban is. Nagyon örültünk, hogy a spanyolok létre tudtak hozni egy komoly tanácsi következtetést, ahol a szegregációt tiltó szankciók, a szegregációt tiltó következtetést fogadtuk el.

De felhívjuk a belga elnökséget, hogy ennél sokkal tovább kell menni. Az európai, az európai elkövetkező hónapokban és a választások idején nagyon-nagyon fontos, hogy minden párt minél több romát válasszon, hogy minél több roma szavazhasson rájuk. Itt a Parlamentben 21 roma származású képviselőnek kéne ülni. Hárman vagyunk.

– Mr President, the Medical Devices Regulation aimed to establish a robust and transparent framework for medical devices. It was welcomed by patients and by practitioners alike at the time, prioritising safety, health and innovation.

However, after more than six years of implementation, the objectives of this legislation have not been fully realised. Short-term challenges – and I acknowledge there has been some attempt to address this – but there has been a serious lack of availability of some products and the current framework lacks predictability and it lacks efficiency.

It fails to keep pace with the required innovation to develop new medical technologies, resulting in increased costs that have a disproportionate effect on SMEs. The converse are alarming for European patients: they are at risk of losing access to the latest technologies, with Europe no longer the choice to launch products, so clinicians are already facing delays and lack of availability of devices.

This is having a disproportionate effect on smaller patient populations, rare diseases and paediatric patients, and the difficulties in establishing this framework need to be addressed as a matter of urgency.

– Г-н Председател, фермерите се бунтуват в Германия, Франция и в родната ми България. Исканията са различни, но има една обща причина за упадъка на селото - това са договорите за свободна търговия. Тя облагодетелства едрия агробизнес и убива добрите стопани на земята. За да отвори далечни пазари на нашата индустрия, тя жертва селата ни, които обезлюдяват. Над 6 милиона ферми ще загинат идните 15 години. Южноамериканското месо, украинското пилешко и слънчоглед не свалят цените, а увеличават печалбите на преработвателите и рушат стандартите за качество.

Глобалната свободна търговия е неолиберална самоцел, която концентрира парите и къса връзката между хората и земята. Днес имаме криза, но утре ще е катастрофа. Да ревизираме зелената сделка, която задушава фермерите и облагодетелства преработвателите. Да опростим правилата, да защитим местната продукция и селото, защото агробизнеса печели от земята, а селяните живеят от нея.

– Tisztelt Elnök Úr! Novák Katalin, Magyarország államfője kegyelmet adott egy pedofil bűnöző bűntársának. Egy magyarországi gyermekotthon igazgatója éveken keresztül szexuálisan bántalmazta a rábízott gyermekeket. Nyolc év börtönt kapott, a rémtetteiről pedig a helyettese is mindent tudott. De nemcsak hogy mindent tudott, hanem hogy hatalmával visszaélve arra kényszerítette a gyermekeket, hogy hamisan tanúzzanak. És most kiderül, hogy Novák Katalin ennek az embernek adott kegyelmet, ezt az embert engedte szabadon. Ha felmerül önökben, hogy ez hogyan lehetséges, én sem tudom rá a választ. Annyit tudunk, hogy az illető kapcsolatban állt a magyar miniszterelnök öccsével is. Úgy tűnik, hogy családi ismerősöknek jár a rendszer védelme.

Politikusként mélységesen elítélem a magyar köztársasági elnök tettét. Édesanyaként pedig a gyomrom forog attól, hogy vannak olyan emberek, akik szemet tudnak hunyni gyermekek sérelmére elkövetett bűncselekmények fölött. Az pedig egyszerűen felfoghatatlan, hogy az egyikük a Magyar Köztársaság elnöke.

– Herr Präsident! Herzlichen Glückwunsch auch noch einmal! Am Wochenende waren in Deutschland wieder Hunderttausende Menschen auf der Straße, und ich finde es beeindruckend, auch gut, dass dort so viele Politikerinnen und Politiker von demokratischen Parteien sind. Ich würde mich aber freuen, wenn wir, wenn demokratische Politiker von Opposition und Regierung, dort auch mit etwas Demut demonstrieren. Denn das, was wir in Deutschland gerade erleben, sind ja nicht die größten Proteste in der Geschichte der Bundesrepublik, weil die Regierung oder die Opposition alles richtig gemacht hat.

Ich glaube, viele Menschen gehen auch auf die Straße, weil ihnen das Vertrauen fehlt, dass es die Regierung gemeinsam mit der demokratischen Opposition hinbekommt, die Menschen für die Demokratie so zu begeistern, dass die Demokratie auch dauerhaft standhält.

Und ich würde mich freuen, wenn wir auch lernen, wie wir wieder lernen, demokratisch zu streiten, wenn wir mehr Orientierung bieten, wenn wir Leidenschaft wieder in die Debatte zurückbringen, und wenn wir auch aufhören, Abschiebung im großem Stil zu fordern, und uns dann wundern, dass Menschen Rechte wählen, wenn wir merken, dass man nicht auf der einen Seite „Nie wieder ist jetzt“ sagen kann und auf der anderen Seite das Asylrecht abschaffen will – denn das ist Kernbestandteil des „Nie wieder“.

– Mr President, under Ursula von der Leyen, we are witnessing not only the Chinafication, but also the communisation of the European Union, and the protests of farmers from all across Europe prove that. In 2019, Ursula von der Leyen said in this Chamber that carbon emissions must have a price that will change our behaviour. All the EU’s so-called green laws, promoted by the Commission in the past years, want to change the behaviour of Europeans through measures that we saw implemented in Eastern Europe by communists when they wanted to take people’s land and mass surveil them.

The utopian communist collectivism could not have been implemented unless people willingly or forcibly gave up their private land to the state. Those who refused to do it had to pay taxes and quotas from their productions that were bigger than what they could harvest. The new carbon laws implemented by the European Commission under Ursula von der Leyen is no different from what the communists did in Eastern Europe to take the land away from the people.
The European farmers are right, and I support their demand to stop the implementation of these green, utopian Marxist ideologies that will bring more poverty and starvation in Europe.

– Herr Präsident! Seit 2014 hat Deutschland zwischen 6 und 7 Millionen illegale Migranten aufgenommen. Diese Migranten, so hat Professor Raffelhüschen von der Universität Freiburg errechnet, werden die Deutschen mindestens 5 800 Milliarden EUR kosten oder 116 Milliarden jedes Jahr, denn die Migranten sind unterqualifiziert, arbeiten kaum, erhalten aber dieselben Sozialleistungen wie Inländer.

Wir hier haben die Wahl: Entweder wir folgen von der Leyen, holen halb Afrika hierhin und zerstören unseren Sozialstaat, oder aber wir ändern unsere Politik. 80 % der Europäer lehnen laut einer INSA-Umfrage von 2021 Ihre Politik der offenen Grenzen ab. Wieso also machen Sie nicht, was 80 % wollen und jedermann bei Sinnen für notwendig hält?

– Senhor Presidente, está prevista para os dias 20 e 21 de fevereiro a audição do Supremo Tribunal do Reino Unido sobre o caso de Julian Assange. Esta é mais uma oportunidade para impedir a extradição do jornalista.

Aqui repetimos o apelo, que em diversos momentos promovemos, dirigido às autoridades competentes do Reino Unido e dos Estados Unidos da América, pedindo a recusa da extradição e o encerramento das acusações contra Julian Assange, com vista à sua imediata libertação.
A tentativa de extradição, criminalização e prisão de Julian Assange representa uma inaceitável pressão, visando condicionar a publicação de informação de interesse público.

O silêncio das instituições da União Europeia relativamente a este caso evidencia bem que a sua preocupação com a liberdade de expressão e a livre prática da atividade de jornalista constituem um exercício de hipocrisia que daqui repudiamos.
Quando, por exemplo, se trata de denunciar os crimes das tropas norte-americanas no Iraque, cai por terra a defesa do jornalismo e dos jornalistas.

– Tisztelt Elnök Úr! Azt már megszoktuk, hogy a nemzetközi média és a baloldal összejátszik, és mondvacsinált ügyekből kreálnak vitát ebben a Házban azzal a céllal, hogy lejárassák Magyarországot. Azt is megszoktuk, hogy kettős mércével mérnek. Tőlünk olyanokat várnak el, amiket másoktól nem, például az igazságszolgáltatás terén, vagy olyan ügyekbe is beleszólnak, amikhez egyébként semmi közük az uniós szabályok alapján. Például, hogy a gyermekvédelem hogy működik Magyarországon. De azért az egy példátlan eset, ami a múlt hét óta folyik. Olaszországból indulva, majd az európai baloldal által felkarolva azzal a céllal, hogy összeugrasszák a magyar és az olasz kormányt egy Magyarországon letartóztatott, brutális bűncselekmény elkövetésével vádolt olasz állampolgár koholt vádjai alapján.

Egy érzékeny pillanatban, amikor valóban Európát érintő súlyos kérdések vannak napirenden. Céljukat nem érték el. Azt a céljukat, hogy Magyarország és Olaszország kormánya ne működjön együtt. De miért van kettős mérce? Egy szlovák állampolgár, akit agyonvertek Charleroi reptéren, Belgiumban, az az ügy nem lépte át ennek a parlamentnek az ingerküszöbét. Kérdezem, hogy most miért vált ez a Ház bírósággá koholt vádak alapján?

– Pane předsedající, vážená paní komisařko, kolegové a kolegyně, já chci připomenout jeden případ v České republice. Před několika týdny zde havaroval kamion plný dobytka. Došlo k obrovskému utrpení skotu a jak v médiích, tak na sociálních sítích se rozvinula obrovská debata občanů o tom, jak je velkou chybou, že se nepodařilo Evropské unii regulovat v rámci animal welfare transport hospodářských zvířat.

A já to tady chci říci, je to náš dluh, nestihli jsme to v tomto volebním období. Bohužel Komise ten návrh předložila pozdě a já doufám, že příští Parlament, příští Komise toto bude řešit, protože tento jeden konkrétní smutný příběh, který se odehrál na území jedné republiky, jednoho členského státu – České republiky –, ukazuje, jak pro evropské občany je toto citlivé téma, jak vnímají nutnost zlepšit podmínky hospodářských zvířat v Evropě a jak bychom měli hlas občanů vnímat a pokusit se ho naplnit.

– Domnule președinte, doamna comisară, stimați colegi, vreau să vorbesc despre piața internă, protecția consumatorului și protecția pieței interne. Vorbim mult, dezbatem mult, Comisia cosmetizează, însă iată unde am ajuns, la încălcări grave ale drepturilor consumatorului de a ști ce consumă.

Iată, avem fermierii în stradă în toată Europa, pentru că, da, se importă carne de cal din Uruguay fără a ști calitatea cărnii. Se importă produse și cereale, produse finite din țări terțe, făcând concurență neloială fermierilor și nu suntem în stare să acoperim cu fapte vorbele pe care le spunem. Au pierdut încrederea și cetățenii și fermierii și trebuie să găsim o soluție.

Cred că soluția, doamna comisară, este următoarea: politica agricolă comună trebuie modificată, acordurile comerciale prin care să protejăm în sfârșit piața internă și să protejăm și consumatorii trebuie revizuite și puse în siguranță, să fie standarde de calitate, standarde de produs, să nu importăm produse la care e exploatată forța de muncă, încât într-adevăr să asigurăm condiții corecte și consumatorilor, și producătorilor din piața internă.

– Mr President, two words: plausible and credible. Not much difference, you would think. By an overwhelming majority, the judges of the International Court of Justice found that South Africa’s claim that Israel had breached certain articles of the Genocide Convention to be ‘plausible’. So what did European governments do on the finding of plausible genocide acts? Nothing.

The following day, and hardly coincidentally, an intelligence assessment found that 12 UNWRA staff out of 13 000 were possibly involved in the horrors of 7 October. A US assessment found this to be ‘credible’. What did EU governments do on the finding of credible intelligence assessment? They cut off humanitarian assistance to the people of Gaza at a time of maximum vulnerability. Well, I think it is both plausible and credible that these governments stand complicit in the war crime of collective punishment of the people of Gaza.

– Mr President, dear Commissioner, the European Commission is currently finalising its upcoming proposal for an EU Space Law. This important initiative envisages common rules to address safety, resilience and sustainability of space activities and operations.

However, in the security pillar there is a gap that needs to be filled. Currently, the EU does not have a harmonised and scientific system to report unidentified anomalous phenomena. This topic, which needs to be a serious issue, needs to be addressed and is being dealt with with the utmost importance in other countries. For example, in the United States, the data collection and analysis of UAP activities in space, civil and military locations is considered as a national security priority. This security concern also led to the creation of a space research programme inside NASA.

Therefore, it is fundamental that the EU Commission includes in the European Space Law a programme to collect data on new UAPs as well as the scientific body to analyse these events in a transparent and public way.

– Mr President, ‘you may have a pistol, but I have a bazooka.’ Is this a line of a Western movie? No, it’s from an article in the Financial Times about the EU plans to undermine the Hungarian economy for political purposes.

‘The EU will sabotage Hungary’s economy if Budapest blocks fresh aid to Ukraine. In a document drawn up by EU officials and seen by the Financial Times, Brussels has outlined a strategy to explicitly target Hungary’s economic weaknesses, imperil its currency and drive a collapse in investor confidence in a bid to hurt jobs and growth if Budapest refuses to lift its veto against the aid to Kyiv. This is Europe telling Viktor Orbán, ‘you may have a pistol, but we have the bazooka.’’

I demand an explanation of the President of the Council, Mr Michel. Does the Council understand that this kind of Wild West behaviour is a danger to EU financial stability? The EU cannot afford a strategy of financial vandalism. So, I ask a written statement of Mr Michel in which he explains his Hungary games.
– Monsieur le Président, chers collègues, le Parlement européen a adopté un rapport sur la conscience historique européenne, dont je dénonce fermement le but et l’inspiration idéologique.

Son but est de «changer l’enseignement de l’histoire en vue» – je le cite –, de faire passer l’histoire européenne avant l’histoire nationale et de favoriser une compréhension supranationale de l’histoire. Dans cette perspective, l’apprentissage de l’intégration européenne occupera une place de choix, ainsi que la vénération de Jean Monnet, seul personnage historique cité par le rapport. Comme les régimes totalitaires, l’Union cède ainsi à la tentation de réécrire l’histoire à des fins de propagande.

Quant à l’inspiration idéologique du texte, c’est celle du wokisme. Dans une sorte de détestation de l’Occident, le rapport préconise en effet de mettre l’accent – je le cite – «sur les périodes tragiques de l’histoire de l’Europe afin de sensibiliser les générations futures aux aberrations du passé». J’estime, quant à moi, que nous n’avons pas à avoir honte de notre civilisation, dont les merveilles sont innombrables. Ne cherchez pas à réécrire l’histoire, laissez-la aux historiens.
– Senhor Presidente, Portugal é o país da União Europeia onde as famílias com crédito à habitação mais sentiram o impacto do aumento das taxas de juro determinadas pelo BCE.

As famílias apertam o cinto, a banca acumula 12 milhões de euros de lucro por dia. Por outro lado, a especulação imobiliária, a desregulamentação do mercado de arrendamento, os preços exorbitantes da habitação colocam em risco esse direito constitucionalmente consagrado.

Os resultados estão à vista. Jovens que não conseguem pagar quartos. Casais que voltam para casa dos pais. Famílias a partilhar casa e a alugar garagens. Idosos despejados de onde viveram durante décadas. Cada vez mais gente a viver na rua.

Daqui saudamos, por isso, os milhares de portugueses que a 27 de janeiro saíram à rua, em 19 cidades do país, exigindo outra política e medidas urgentes: a reversão das taxas de juro, colocando os lucros da banca a suportar os aumentos das prestações, mais habitação pública, o combate à especulação, controlar rendas, travar os despejos, pôr fim aos regimes de residentes não habituais, garantir o direito à habitação para todos.

– Signor Presidente, onorevoli colleghi, siamo nel 2024, ventunesimo secolo. Le elezioni europee sono alle porte, eppure nel mio paese, in Italia, quasi 5 milioni di persone, il 10 % degli aventi diritto, rischiano di non poter votare.

È un'ingiustizia che tocca in particolare i giovani dai 18 ai 35 anni, giovani che, per scelta o per necessità, vivono fuori dal proprio comune di residenza, in Italia o all'estero, per studio o per lavoro. Calpestando lo spirito dei trattati, della Carta di Nizza e, ancora, dell'Atto elettorale europeo, l'Italia è ancora l'unico grande paese europeo a non aver introdotto alcun meccanismo di voto per corrispondenza, né per delega né, tantomeno, online.

Io sono un figlio della generazione Erasmus. Studiavo in Francia nel 2008, quando, per lo stesso identico motivo, ho dovuto purtroppo perdere la mia unica elezione. Sedici anni dopo nulla è cambiato. Solo tante promesse. Io oggi, in quest'Aula, porto la voce di questi milioni di ragazze e ragazzi che non possono più aspettare, che non devono essere privati ancora una volta del loro diritto di scegliere i propri rappresentanti, e forse anche della gioia del primo voto.

Presenterò un'interrogazione urgente alla Commissione europea per chiederle di agire con la massima urgenza, richiamando il governo italiano alle sue responsabilità. Il minimo è introdurre immediatamente un rimborso totale delle spese di viaggio. Mi batterò in quest'Aula e Azione si batterà in ogni istituzione fino a quando non sarà finalmente riconosciuto loro il diritto di avere diritti.

– Κύριε Πρόεδρε, την Τετάρτη στην ολομέλεια οι γνωστές πολιτικές ομάδες για μια ακόμη φορά επιτίθενται στη χώρα μου, την Ελλάδα, προωθώντας ένα ψήφισμα για το κράτος δικαίου και την ελευθερία του Τύπου επιεικώς απαράδεκτο. Διότι συνειδητά παραγνωρίζουν τις σοβαρές θεσμικές και διοικητικές μεταρρυθμίσεις που έχει φέρει η κυβέρνηση τα τελευταία τέσσερα χρόνια και παραλείπουν σκοπίμως τα επίσημα συμπεράσματα της έκθεσης της Επιτροπής του 2023 για το κράτος δικαίου, στην οποία υπογραμμίζεται η πρόοδος της χώρας μου σε συστάσεις της. Είναι δε προκλητικό το γεγονός ότι το ψήφισμα υιοθετεί σκόπιμα fake news και αυθαίρετους ισχυρισμούς που διαδίδει η αντιπολίτευση στην Ελλάδα. Επιπρόσθετα, επιχειρείται παρέμβαση αθέμιτα στην ανεξάρτητη ελληνική Δικαιοσύνη για εκκρεμείς υποθέσεις. Το θέμα, συνάδελφοι, είναι πολύ σοβαρό. Το εν λόγω ψήφισμα εξυπηρετεί πολιτικές σκοπιμότητες ενόψει των ευρωεκλογών, σε μια προσπάθεια να πληγεί η αυτοδύναμη κυβέρνηση της Ελλάδας και ο πρωθυπουργός της Κυριάκος Μητσοτάκης. Κείμενα όπως το εν λόγω αποτελούν επιτομή λαϊκισμού και παραπληροφόρησης και, δυστυχώς, κλονίζουν την αξιοπιστία του Ευρωπαϊκού Κοινοβουλίου.

– Monsieur le Président, une fraude, un mensonge, un échec. Je voudrais évoquer ici, dans cet hémicycle, la situation de l’entreprise Nestlé Waters, qui, pendant des années, a caché avoir utilisé pour ses eaux minérales des méthodes interdites. Cette entreprise a filtré et purifié ses eaux minérales comme une vulgaire eau du robinet, mais en la vendant cent fois plus cher. Le gouvernement français a couvert cette arnaque et il s’apprêtait à légaliser ces pratiques, qui trompent et volent les consommateurs.

Ces fraudes doivent être punies. Mais combien de marques et de sources sont concernées en Europe? Nous ne le savons pas, nous avons besoin d’urgence d’une enquête menée par la Commission européenne. Pourquoi ont-ils fait cela? Parce que la qualité des eaux baisse, parce que la pollution progresse, parce que les pesticides sont partout. Des milliers d’emplois sont désormais en jeu parce que nous avons échoué à protéger l’environnement.
Une leçon à retenir en pleine crise agricole: l’usage massif des pesticides est un danger pour la santé, pour l’environnement, mais aussi pour l’emploi.

– Κύριε Πρόεδρε, η πρόσφατη έκθεση της Διεθνούς Διαφάνειας (Transparency International) παρουσιάζει εξαιρετικό ενδιαφέρον. Καταγράφει σημαντική πτώση της Ελλάδας στα ζητήματα του κράτους δικαίου. Ταυτόχρονα, επισημαίνει άνοδο, μεταξύ των Ελλήνων, της αντίληψης ότι πρόκειται για μία χώρα με πρόβλημα διαφθοράς. Ουσιαστικά, η έκθεση συνδέει τη μη τήρηση των κανόνων του κράτους δικαίου με την αύξηση της διαφθοράς. Όταν το κράτος γίνεται κομματικό, όταν περιορίζεται η ελευθερία των μέσων ενημέρωσης, όταν περιορίζεται η ανεξαρτησία της δικαιοσύνης μέσα από παρεμβάσεις της εκτελεστικής εξουσίας, όταν αποδυναμώνονται οι ανεξάρτητες αρχές και χρησιμοποιείται η κοινοβουλευτική πλειοψηφία για συγκάλυψη σκανδάλων, δεν υποβαθμίζεται μόνο το κράτος δικαίου, αλλά αυξάνεται και η διαφθορά λόγω λιγότερης διαφάνειας και περιορισμένου δημοκρατικού ελέγχου. Για αυτό, χρειαζόμαστε συνεπή τήρηση των κανόνων του κράτους δικαίου.

– Herr Präsident! In letzter Zeit frage ich mich manchmal, wofür wir eigentlich dieses Europäische Parlament hier brauchen. Können Sie es mir beantworten? Ich würde sagen, das Allererste, was mir in den Sinn kommt, ist natürlich, dass wir wissen, dass wir gemeinsam einfach bessere Entscheidungen treffen, dass wir gemeinsam einfach mehr Menschen das geben können, was sie brauchen, und dass wir gemeinsam einfach viel mehr dieser wunderbaren Rechte schaffen können, wie das die EU tut.

Aber wenn wir auf die letzten Jahre schauen, dann haben wir in dem Bereich – ich glaube – sehr oft versagt. Wir haben die Schere zwischen Arm und Reich immer größer werden lassen, und das lässt die Leute an der Legitimität dieses Parlaments zweifeln. Das lässt die Leute zweifeln daran, dass wir hier wirklich im Interesse der Bürgerinnen und Bürger handeln.

Deswegen muss es für die nächste Europawahl doch klar sein, dass wir die Verteilungsfrage stellen müssen. Sonst schützen wir Europa, das Europäische Parlament und die EU garantiert nicht vor den Angriffen von rechts.

– Domnule președinte, dragi colegi, la 17 ani de la aderarea la Uniunea Europeană și la 20 de ani de la aderarea la NATO, este timpul ca România să își asume cu maturitate apartenența la cele două organizații.

Prin aderarea la UE și NATO, populația României este protejată împotriva amenințărilor reprezentate de Federația Rusă, a avut acces la miliarde de euro pentru dezvoltarea țării și a beneficiat de mai multe drepturi și oportunități. Poporul român trebuie să-și apere acest drept câștigat cu greu în fața liderilor extremiști de la AUR și S.O.S., care ar face orice să ne scoată din UE și NATO.

Trebuie să apărăm suveranitatea românilor prin introducerea în Constituția României a apartenenței la UE și NATO, deoarece doar așa putem evita ca partidele extremiste să manipuleze în viitor Parlamentul în a adopta o decizie de ieșire din cele două structuri, catastrofală din punct de vedere economic și social. Izolarea, de fapt, înseamnă sărăcie.

Soluția este să întărim cu profesionalism profilul României în UE și NATO pentru a le face mai eficiente și mai apropiate de nevoile românilor. Spun cu fermitate: mă opun extremismului, sunt Anti-Ro-Exit.

– Domnule președinte, stimată doamnă comisară Adina Vălean, mă bucur că sunteți în această seară aici, la această dezbatere. Dragi colegi, este vital, mai ales în acest an, să nu dăm motiv extremiștilor să utilizeze și să sporească sentimentele antieuropene.

Este important ca toți cetățenii europeni să simtă că în Uniunea Europeană au aceleași drepturi, că toți suntem egali și că noi, Parlamentul European, suntem aici să apărăm interesele tuturor cetățenilor Uniunii. Egalitatea în drepturi nu este încă atinsă la nivelul Uniunii noastre, iar faptul că cetățenii români și bulgari, deși europeni, nu au drept de liberă trecere, la fel ca toți ceilalți europeni, este puternic exploatat pentru a crește valul antieuropean. Am auzit și în seara aceasta discursuri ale unor colegi în acest sens.
Trebuie să ne asigurăm că nicio țară nu poate să treacă peste voința majorității atunci când este vorba despre cetățenii noștri, despre drepturile noastre.
Damit ist dieser Tagesordnungspunkt geschlossen.
